Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were part of an ODI series just before the marquee tournament where the Proteas registered a comeback win.
South Africa won their opening match against Sri Lanka while Australia lost against India in Chennai.
The Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow has produced often produced spin-friendly tracks with an average score of 210.
Batting second on this ground could be slightly easier if the dew factor comes into play.
Australia had a horrid start to their campaign with a six-wicket loss against India.
The Proteas batting has been in incredible form with the likes of Aiden Markram, Henrich Klassen and Rassie van der Dussen scoring a lot of runs.
The bowling could still be an area of improvement as they conceded 326 in their World Cup opener against Sri Lanka.
